content:
sDawn Lammey looks to bring the ball down the field against Temple last night PERIOD

Advertisement

As dusk fell upon Bigler Field last night dawn broke on the Temple Lady Owls PERIOD

Dawn Lammey that is PERIOD

The senior midfielder scored a Lady Lion field hockey team recordtying five goals in a  drubbing of Temple  PERIOD The 10goal victory also set a Bigler Field record for goals scored PERIOD

Head coach Char Morett said of the victory 

Probably not PERIOD The No PERIOD  Lions  owned Temple from the word go completely controlling the offensive zone and allowing minimal Owl encroachment to the Lion end of the field limiting Temple to only four shots PERIOD

The Lions came out firing but despite an initial flurry of shots and penalty corner attempts they could not connect ball to net PERIOD However Penn State continued to pressure the Temple defense which soon resembled a person trying to plug a dam with a finger PERIOD Sooner or later it was going to burst PERIOD

s D awn Lammey looks to bring the ball down the field against Temple last night PERIOD

Traci Anselmo began the flood of Lion goals with  remaining in the first half PERIOD Shortly after Lammey notched her first of the evening PERIOD The Lions onslaught continued as the team scored three more goals in as many minutes PERIOD Tracey Larson put a spectacular diving shot past Owl goalkeeper Serene McGrath PERIOD A minute later Lammey chalked up goal number two and with six seconds remaining Maegan Galie put one home in dazzling fashion on a backwards shot that gave the Lions a comfortable  lead at the intermission PERIOD

The Lions didnt miss a beat in the second half PERIOD Lammey tallied a hat trick five minutes into the half on a whistler from the circle line PERIOD Maegan Galie followed with her second score of the night and Irene Kofroth got her first career goal to up the Lion ante to  PERIOD

Then Lammey took over PERIOD Her fourth goal of the night looked like a David Copperfield act PERIOD In front of the net on her stomach and facing the wrong way Lammey flipped the ball behind her and past the pads of Temple goalkeeper April Herman PERIOD Her recordtying goal was also impressive as she blasted a shot while on her knees PERIOD

The record had been held since  shortly after Lammeys first birthday by a young Char Morett PERIOD

Upon learning who the previous owner of the record was Lammey halfjoked 

Morett was glad to have Lammeys company in the record books PERIOD



Lammey wasnt quite finished PERIOD As if she hadnt inflicted enough damage to Temples pride she tried to inflict some pain too PERIOD Shortly after tying the record Lammey was given a green card a violation for rough play PERIOD

Hoping she could keep the tie with Lammey Morett teasingly suggested the referee 

Lammey shrugged off the incident PERIOD 

Following the game Temple head coach Lauren Fuchs had little to say of her teams performance PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

The victory provided the confidence boost the Lions needed as they open Big Ten play at home Friday against rival Iowa PERIOD
